title: Revealed: How Manchester City almost lost Pep Guardiola - over a house
text:
Pep Guardiola considered pulling the plug on a deal to become Manchester City manager - because he could not find the right house to live in.

City had struck a deal for Guardiola to succeed Manuel Pellegrini while the Catalan was in charge of Bayern Munich.

But less than two months after City had announced in February 2016 that Guardiola would take charge, officials at the club became concerned that the former Barcelona coach might back out.

Guardiola wanted to move into a city centre residence in Manchester with his family that bore comparison to the mansion they spent three years living in in Munich.

But with Manchester unable to provide anything to match those specific requirements, City’s top brass became increasingly concerned that Guardiola was going to have a change of heart and walk away from their agreement.

The story was revealed in a fascinating new book about Guardiola by Spanish journalists, Pol Ballus and Lu Martin, that charts the Catalan’s extraordinary journey at City.
